title: CompileSignedTransactionIntentRequest
description: Takes in a raw transaction intent as well as its signatures and compiles it. This is useful when a notary wishes to notarize a signed transaction intent.

intent_signatures.description: A vector of transaction intent signatures.

TransactionIntent.description: A transaction intent which is made of the header containing the transaction metadata and a manifest consisting of the instructions and blobs.

header.description: A transaction header of the transaction metadata.

manifest.description: A transaction manifest of the transaction instructions and blobs.

TransactionHeader.description: A transaction header containing metadata and other transaction information.

version.description: An 8 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the transaction version. Currently, this value is always 1.

network_id.description: An 8 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the id of the network that this transaction is meant for.

start_epoch_inclusive.description: A 64 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the start of the epoch window in which this transaction executes. This value is inclusive.

end_epoch_exclusive.description: A 64 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the end of the epoch window in which this transaction executes. This value is exclusive.

nonce.description: A 64 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents a random nonce used for this transaction.

notary_public_key.description: The public key of the entity that will be notarizing this transaction.

notary_as_signatory.description: When `true` the notary's signature is also treated as an intent signature and therefore a virtual badge of the signature is added to the auth zone when the transaction auth zone at the beginning of the transaction.

cost_unit_limit.description: A 32 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the limit or maximum amount of cost units that the transaction is allowed to use.

tip_percentage.description: A 16 bit unsigned integer serialized as a string which represents the percentage of tips given to validators for this transaction.

PublicKey.description: A discriminated union of the possible public keys used by Scrypto and the Radix Engine.

oneOf.description: A byte array of 33 bytes which are serialized as a 66 character long hex-encoded string representing a public key from the ECDSA Secp256k1 elliptic curve.
A byte array of 32 bytes which are serialized as a 64 character long hex-encoded string representing a public key from the EDDSA Ed25519 edwards curve.

TransactionManifest.description: A transaction intent consisting of instructions as well as blobs

instructions.description: The transaction manifest instructions to be executed in the transaction.

blobs.description: An array of byte arrays which is serialized as an array of hex strings which represents the blobs included in the transaction.

InstructionList.description: A discriminated union of possible representations of manifest instructions. Currently, two representations are supported: a string representation which is the same as that seen in the local simulator, resim, and pretty much everywhere, as well as a parsed format which is a vector of instructions where each instruction is represented through the `Instruction` model.

Instruction.description: The Instruction model defines the structure that transaction manifest instructions follow during communication with the Radix Engine Toolkit

oneOf.description: An instruction to call a function with the given list of arguments on the given package address and blueprint name.

package_address.description: The address of the package containing the blueprint that contains the desired function. This package address is serialized as the `PackageAddress` variant of the `Value` model.

blueprint_name.description: A string of the name of the blueprint containing the desired function. This field is serialized as a `String` from the Value model.

function_name.description: A string of the name of the function to call. This field is serialized as a `String` from the Value model.

arguments.description: An optional array of `Value` arguments to call the function with. If this array is empty or is not provided, then the function is called with no arguments.

oneOf.description: An instruction to call a method with a given name on a given component address with the given list of arguments.

component_address.description: The address of the component which contains the method to be invoked. This field is serialized as a `ComponentAddress` from the Value model.

method_name.description: A string of the name of the method to call. his field is serialized as a `String` from the Value model.

arguments.description: An optional array of `Value` arguments to call the method with. If this array is empty or is not provided, then the method is called with no arguments.

oneOf.description: An instruction to take the entire amount of a given resource address from the worktop and put it in a bucket.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to take from the worktop. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

into_bucket.description: A bucket to put the taken resources into. This field is serialized as a `Bucket` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to take the an amount of a given resource address from the worktop and put it in a bucket.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to take from the worktop. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

amount.description: The amount of the resource to take from the worktop. This field is serialized as a `Decimal` from the Value model.

into_bucket.description: A bucket to put the taken resources into. This field is serialized as a `Bucket` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to take the a set of non-fungible ids of a given resource address from the worktop and put it in a bucket.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to take from the worktop. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

ids.description: The non-fungible ids to take from the worktop. This is a set (serialized as a JSON array) of `NonFungibleId`s from the Value model.

into_bucket.description: A bucket to put the taken resources into. This field is serialized as a `Bucket` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: Returns a bucket of tokens to the worktop.

bucket.description: The bucket to return to the worktop.

oneOf.description: An instruction to assert that a given resource exists in the worktop.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to perform the assertion on. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to assert that a specific amount of a specific resource address exists in the worktop.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to perform the assertion on. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

amount.description: The amount of the resource to assert their existence in the worktop. This field is serialized as a `Decimal` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to assert that a set ids of a specific resource address exists in the worktop.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to perform the assertion on. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

ids.description: The non-fungible ids of the resource to assert their existence in the worktop. This is a set (serialized as a JSON array) of `NonFungibleId`s from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction which pops a proof from the AuthZone stack and into an identifiable proof

into_proof.description: The proof to put the popped proof into. This is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction that pushes a proof to the auth zone stack.

proof.description: The proof to push to the auth zone stack. This is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction which clears the auth zone stack by dropping all of the proofs in that stack.
An instruction to create a proof of the entire amount of a given resource address from the auth zone.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to create a proof of. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

into_proof.description: A proof to put the resource proof into. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a proof of the an amount of a given resource address from the auth zone.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to create a proof of. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

amount.description: The amount of the resource to create a proof of. This field is serialized as a `Decimal` from the Value model.

into_proof.description: A proof to put the resource proof into. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a proof of the a set of non-fungible ids of a given resource address from the auth zone.

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to create a proof of. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

ids.description: The non-fungible ids to create a proof of. This is a set (serialized as a JSON array) of `NonFungibleId`s from the Value model.

into_proof.description: A proof to put the resource proof into. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a proof given a bucket of some resources

bucket.description: The bucket of resources to create a proof from. This field is serialized as a `Bucket` from the Value model.

into_proof.description: The proof variable that the proof should go to. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to clone a proof creating a second proof identical to the original

proof.description: The original proof, or the proof to be cloned. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

into_proof.description: The proof variable that the proof should go to. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to drop a proof.

proof.description: The proof to drop. This field is serialized as a `Proof` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to drop all proofs currently present in the transaction context.
An instruction to publish a package and set it's associated royalty configs, metadata, and access rules.

code.description: The blob of the package code. This field is serialized as a `Blob` from the Value model.

abi.description: The blob of the package ABI. This field is serialized as a `Blob` from the Value model.

royalty_config.description: The configurations of the royalty for the package. The underlying type of this is a Map where the key is a string of the blueprint name and the value is a `RoyaltyConfig`. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

metadata.description: The metadata to use for the package. The underlying type of this is a string-string Map of the metadata. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

access_rules.description: The access rules to use for the package. This is serialized as a `Tuple` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to publish a package with an associated "owner" badge where all of the authority on the package is in the hands of said owner.

code.description: The blob of the package code. This field is serialized as a `Blob` from the Value model.

abi.description: The blob of the package ABI. This field is serialized as a `Blob` from the Value model.

owner_badge.description: The non-fungible address of the owner badge of this package. This field is serialized as a `NonFungibleAddress` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to burn a bucket of tokens.

bucket.description: The bucket of tokens to burn.

oneOf.description: An instruction ot recall resources from a known vault.

vault_id.description: The id of the vault of the tokens to recall. This field is serialized as an `Own` from the value model and is expected to be an `Own::Vault`.

amount.description: The amount of tokens to recall from the vault. This field is serialized as a `Decimal` field from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to set the metadata on an entity.

entity_address.description: The address of the entity to set metadata on. This is a discriminated union of types where it can either be a `ResourceAddress`, `ComponentAddress`, `PackageAddress` or a `SystemAddress`.

key.description: A string of the key to set the metadata for. This field is serialized as a `String` from the Value model.

value.description: A string of the value to set the metadata for. This field is serialized as a `String` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to modify the royalties of a package.

package_address.description: The address of the package to set the royalty on. This is serialized as a `PackageAddress` from the Value model.

royalty_config.description: The configurations of the royalty for the package. The underlying type of this is a Map where the key is a string of the blueprint name and the value is a `RoyaltyConfig`. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to modify the royalties on a component

component_address.description: The component address of the component to modify royalties for. This field is serialized as a `ComponentAddress` from the Value model.

royalty_config.description: The royalty config to set on the component. This is an `Enum` from the `Value` model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to claim royalties of a package

package_address.description: The package address of the package to claim royalties for. This field is serialized as a `PackageAddress` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to claim royalties of a component

component_address.description: The component address of the component to claim royalties for. This field is serialized as a `ComponentAddress` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to modify the access rules of a method that an entity has.

entity_address.description: The entity address of the entity to modify the access rules for.

index.description: Entity access rules is a stack of access rules, this index allows referring to a specific "layer" in said stack. This field is serialized as a `U32` from the `Value` model.

key.description: The method key for the method to set the access rule of. This field is serialized as an `Enum` from the Value model

rule.description: The new access rule to set in-place of the old one. This field is serialized as an `Enum` from the Value model

oneOf.description: An instruction to mint fungible resources

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to mint tokens of. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

amount.description: The amount of fungible tokens to mint of this resource. This field is serialized as a `Decimal` from the Value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to mind non-fungibles of a resource

resource_address.description: The address of the resource to mint tokens of. This field is serialized as a `ResourceAddress` from the Value model.

entries.description: The non-fungible tokens to mint. The underlying type of this is a map which maps a `NonFungibleId` to a tuple of two `Value` elements where each element is a struct of the immutable and mutable parts of the non-fungible data.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a new fungible resource.

divisibility.description: The divisibility of the resource. This field is serialized as a `U8` from the Value model.

metadata.description: The metadata to set on the resource. The underlying type of this is a string-string Map of the metadata. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

access_rules.description: The access rules to use for the resource. The underlying type of this is a map which maps a `ResourceMethodAuthKey` enum to a tuple of two `AccessRule`s denoting the current behavior and the mutability. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

initial_supply.description: An optional decimal value of the initial supply to mint during resource creation. If present, this is serialized as a `Decimal` from the value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a fungible resource with an associated "owner" badge where all of the authority on the resource is in the hands of said owner.

divisibility.description: The divisibility of the resource. This field is serialized as a `U8` from the Value model.

metadata.description: The metadata to set on the resource. The underlying type of this is a string-string Map of the metadata. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

owner_badge.description: The non-fungible address of the owner badge of this resource. This field is serialized as a `NonFungibleAddress` from the Value model.

initial_supply.description: An optional decimal value of the initial supply to mint during resource creation. If present, this is serialized as a `Decimal` from the value model.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a new non-fungible resource.

id_type.description: The type of the non-fungible id to use for this resource. This field is serialized as an `Enum` from the Value model.

metadata.description: The metadata to set on the resource. The underlying type of this is a string-string Map of the metadata. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

access_rules.description: The access rules to use for the resource. The underlying type of this is a map which maps a `ResourceMethodAuthKey` enum to a tuple of two `AccessRule`s denoting the current behavior and the mutability. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

initial_supply.description: An optional initial supply for the non-fungible resource being created. The underlying type of this is a map which maps a `NonFungibleId` to a tuple of two `Value` elements where each element is a struct of the immutable and mutable parts of the non-fungible data.

oneOf.description: An instruction to create a non-fungible resource with an associated "owner" badge where all of the authority on the resource is in the hands of said owner.

id_type.description: The type of the non-fungible id to use for this resource. This field is serialized as an `Enum` from the Value model.

metadata.description: The metadata to set on the resource. The underlying type of this is a string-string Map of the metadata. This is serialized as an `Array` from the Value model.

owner_badge.description: The non-fungible address of the owner badge of this resource. This field is serialized as a `NonFungibleAddress` from the Value model.

initial_supply.description: An optional initial supply for the non-fungible resource being created. The underlying type of this is a map which maps a `NonFungibleId` to a tuple of two `Value` elements where each element is a struct of the immutable and mutable parts of the non-fungible data.

oneOf.description: An instruction to registers a new validator given the public key of the validator

validator.description: The public key of the validator

oneOf.description: An instruction to unregister a validator given it's public key

validator.description: The public key of the validator to unregister

Value.description: The Value model used to describe all of the types that the Radix Engine Toolkit accepts and returns.

oneOf.description: A boolean value which can either be true or false
An 8-bit unsigned integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 16-bit unsigned integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 32-bit unsigned integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 64-bit unsigned integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 128-bit unsigned integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
An 8-bit signed integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 16-bit signed integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 32-bit signed integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 64-bit signed integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A 128-bit signed integer which is serialized and deserialized as a string.
A type representing a string
A Rust-style Enum which has a variant and can optionally also have a list of values (acting in a way similar to discriminated algebraic sum types)

variant.description: The name of the variant of the enum

fields.description: Optional fields that the enum may have

oneOf.description: The `Some` case of Rust Options where the value is some Value
The `None` case of Rust Options where there is value
The `Ok` case of Rust Results where the value is some Value
The `Err` case of Rust Results where the value is some Value
An array values of a single value kind

element_kind.description: The kind of elements that the array contains. An array will be validated to ensure that it contains a single element kind.

elements.description: The elements of the array which may contain 0 or more elements.

oneOf.description: An array of elements where elements could be of different kinds.
Represents a tagged enum of Radix Engine Nodes which may be owned in the point of view of the transaction manifest.
Represents an owned KeyValueStore
Represents an owned Component
Represents an owned Vault
Represents an owned Bucket identified through an unsigned 32-bit integer which is serialized as a string
Represents an owned Proof identified through an unsigned 32-bit integer which is serialized as a string
Represents a Bech32m encoded human-readable component address. This address is serialized as a human-readable bech32m encoded string.
Represents a Bech32m encoded human-readable resource address. This address is serialized as a human-readable bech32m encoded string.
Represents a Bech32m encoded human-readable system address. This address is serialized as a human-readable bech32m encoded string.
Represents a Bech32m encoded human-readable package address. This address is serialized as a human-readable bech32m encoded string.

Represents a hash coming from Scrypto's and the Radix Engine's common hash function. The hashing function that they use is SHA256 which produces 32 byte long hashes which are serialized as a 64 character long hex string (since hex encoding doubles the number of bytes needed)
A byte array of 33 bytes which are serialized as a 66 character long hex-encoded string representing a public key from the ECDSA Secp256k1 elliptic curve.

A byte array of 65 bytes which are serialized as a 130 character long hex-encoded string representing a signature from the ECDSA Secp256k1 elliptic curve. An important note on ECDSA Secp256k1 signatures is that the format used and accepted by Scrypto is [v, r, s] where `v` is the recovery id and is a single byte and `r` and `s` are the signature results and are 32 bytes each.
A byte array of 32 bytes which are serialized as a 64 character long hex-encoded string representing a public key from the EDDSA Ed25519 edwards curve.
A byte array of 64 bytes which are serialized as a 128 character long hex-encoded string representing a signature from the EDDSA Ed25519 edwards curve.
Represents a Scrypto bucket which is identified through a transient identifier which is either a string or an unsigned 32-bit integer which is serialized as a number.
Represents a Scrypto proof which is identified through a transient identifier which is either a string or an unsigned 32-bit integer which is serialized as a number.
Represents non-fungible ids which is a discriminated union of the different types that non-fungible ids may be.
A 32 bit unsigned integer non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
A 64 bit unsigned integer non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
A 128 bit unsigned integer UUID non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
An byte array non-fungible id type which is serialized as a hex string
A string non-fungible id
Represents a non-fungible address which may be considered as the "global" address of a non-fungible unit as it contains both the resource address and the non-fungible id for that unit.
Represents a transaction manifest expression.
Represents the hash of a blob provided as part of a transaction manifest. This is represented as a byte array of 32 bytes which is serialized as a hex string.
Represents a byte array of an unknown size which is serialized as a hex string

ValueKind.description: An Enum of all of the supported kinds of values by the Radix Engine Toolkit. This enum is essentially the `type` tags used for the value model.

NodeIdentifier.description: Represents a Radix Engine persistent node identifier which is 36 bytes long and serialized as a hexadecimal string of length 72 (since hex encoding doubles the number of bytes needed.)

BucketId.description: Represents a BucketId which uses a transient identifier.

TransientIdentifier.description: Represents an untagged transient identifier typically used as an identifiers for Scrypto buckets and proofs. Could either be a string or an unsigned 32-bit number (which is serialized as a number and not a string)

ProofId.description: Represents a ProofId which uses a transient identifier.

Blob.description: Represents the hash of a blob provided as part of a transaction manifest. This is represented as a byte array of 32 bytes which is serialized as a hex string.

NonFungibleId.description: Represents non-fungible ids which is a discriminated union of the different types that non-fungible ids may be.

oneOf.description: A 32 bit unsigned integer non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
A 64 bit unsigned integer non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
A 128 bit unsigned integer UUID non-fungible id type which is serialized as a string
An byte array non-fungible id type which is serialized as a hex string
A string non-fungible id

SignatureWithPublicKey.description: A discriminated union of the possible pairs of signatures and public keys used by Scrypto and the Radix Engine.

oneOf.description: Cryptographic signature and public key for Ecdsa Secp256k1

signature.description: A byte array of 65 bytes which are serialized as a 130 character long hex-encoded string representing a signature from the ECDSA Secp256k1 elliptic curve. An important note on ECDSA Secp256k1 signatures is that the format used and accepted by Scrypto is [v, r, s] where `v` is the recovery id and is a single byte and `r` and `s` are the signature results and are 32 bytes each. In this case, only a signature is needed since the public key can be derived from the signature if the message is available.

oneOf.description: Cryptographic signature and public key for EdDSA Ed25519

public_key.description: A byte array of 32 bytes which are serialized as a 64 character long hex-encoded string representing a public key from the EDDSA Ed25519 edwards curve.

signature.description: A byte array of 64 bytes which are serialized as a 128 character long hex-encoded string representing a signature from the EDDSA Ed25519 edwards curve.
